p: IFNs act through JAK/STAT pathway to increase the expression of IFN response genes, and type I IFNs are the primary defense against viral infections [ 137]. JAK inhibitors interfere with antiviral immune response, and increased risk of herpes zoster and simplex infections were previously reported with JAK inhibitor use [ 138]. Since the effective containment and clearance of the virus depends on an effective and abrupt type I IFN response, initiation of JAK inhibitors at the early phase of COVID-19 could interfere with the immune defense. Thus, the jury is out for the benefit of these drugs in COVID-19.
